**18. What year did you serve your Great Christmas dinner in eastern Iowa?**

---

**Mother served Christmas dinner in 1843. I do not remember the names of any of the guests at that time.**

---

**19. Have you ever refused to accept stationery or other produce foods? Give details.**

---

**We lived very plainly, but generally had corn, milk, butter, and an egg every day, etc., to be a hard life.**

---

**20. How did you feel when you heard the news that your family would be moved westward?**

---

**As soon as we heard the news, we knew that we had to move immediately. We immediately started to pack our belongings and head westward.**

---

**21. What was the most memorable event in your life?**

---

**The most memorable event in my life was the day I met my husband. We fell in love instantly and have been together ever since.**

---

**22. What advice would you give to someone who wants to learn about your traditions and customs?**

---

**Learn about the history of your ancestors and their traditions. It will help you understand where you came from and what makes you unique.**

15. **BREAKFAST RECIPES**

   - **Pudding:** A favorite dish made from flour, sugar, milk, and eggs. It was often served with jam or honey.

   - **Porridge:** Made from oatmeal cooked in milk until thick and creamy. Often served with sugar or honey.

   - **Bread:** Made from flour, water, yeast, and salt. It was usually eaten with butter or jam.

   - **Butter:** Made from cream, salted and churned until it becomes solid.

   - **Jam:** Made from fruit, sugar, and pectin. It was often spread on bread or used in desserts.

   - **Honey:** A natural sweetener made by bees. It was often used in baking or as a topping for porridge.

   - **Sugar:** Made from sugarcane or sugar beets. It was used in many recipes for flavor and sweetness.

---

16. **CHRISTMAS**

   - **Christmas Dinner:** Traditionally included roast turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, and gravy. Desserts such as mince pie and plum pudding were also common.

   - **Christmas Cake:** A rich, spiced cake often decorated with marzipan and fondant.

   - **Christmas Pudding:** A steamed pudding made with suet, breadcrumbs, currants, and spices. It was often served with brandy sauce.

   - **Christmas Pudding Recipe:**

     2 \text{ cups flour} \\
     1 \text{ cup brown sugar} \\
     1 \text{ cup currants} \\
     1 \text{ cup raisins} \\
     1 \text{ cup chopped nuts} \\
     1 \text{ tsp cinnamon} \\
     1 \text{ tsp nutmeg} \\
     1 \text{ tsp allspice} \\
     1 \text{ tsp baking powder} \\
     1 \text{ tsp salt} \\
     1 \text{ cup milk} \\
     1 \text{ cup butter} \\
     1 \text{ egg}
     \]

     \[
     \text{Instructions:} \\
     1. \text{Mix all dry ingredients together.} \\
     2. \text{Add milk, butter, and egg to the mixture.} \\
     3. \text{Stir until well combined.} \\
     4. \text{Pour into a greased baking dish.} \\
     5. \text{Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.}
     \]

17. **NEW YEAR'S DAY**

   - **New Year's Day Dinner:** Usually included roast beef, Yorkshire pudding, carrots, and cabbage. Desserts such as trifle and mince pie were also common.

   - **New Year's Day Cake:** A rich, spiced cake often decorated with marzipan and fondant.

   - **New Year's Day Pudding:** A steamed pudding made with suet, breadcrumbs, currants, and spices. It was often served with brandy sauce.

Dear Mrs. Russell,

I am writing to you from our home in [location]. We have been here for about two weeks now, and I wanted to share some of our experiences with you.

We arrived here by train, which was quite an adventure. The journey took us several days, and we had to endure some rough weather conditions along the way. However, we managed to arrive safely and are now settled into our new home.

Our house is quite large and has plenty of space for all of us. We have set up our living area, dining room, and bedrooms, and everything seems to be working well so far. The weather here is quite different from what we are used to, but we are adjusting to it quickly.

We have met many friendly neighbors already, and they have been very welcoming. We have also started to explore the local area, and there are many interesting places to visit.

If you ever decide to come visit us, we would be more than happy to show you around. We have a lot to share with you about our new life here.

Best regards,
